etymologies: early 20th century: from modern Latin Therapsida, from Greek thēr ‘beast’ + hapsis, hapsid- ‘arch’ (referring to the structure of the skull)

definitions: an extinct reptile of a Permian and Triassic order, the members of which are related to the ancestors of mammals.

notes.text: Order Therapsida, subclass Synapsida: many families and numerous genera, including the cynodonts

shortDefinitions: fossil reptile of Permian and Triassic order
